newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador to enter debt talks with Paris club.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador to enter debt talks with Paris club.

text.p: Ecuador will open debt-rescheduling talks with the Paris Club of creditor nations next week, Monetary Board President Danilo Carrera said Thursday.
"Between Thursday and Friday next week we will be in Paris to start the first talks," Carrera told foreign correspondents.
He added that the talks will start after Ecuador's government takes part in the annual meeting of the Inter-American Development Bank this weekend in Barcelona.
Carrera said Ecuador wants to renegotiate some $400 million worth of debt that matured last year and will mature in 1997 of its total $1.2 billion debt with the Paris Club.
Ecuador's total external debt amounts to more than $14.5 billion.
